rows.title: Day One: Module Reminder

text.eng: Good day! This is a reminder that the first MaPa Chat module will start [SET TIME] later. I'm excited to start the program with you! We'll start building a Happy Home with a simple yet effective tip: doing One-on-One Time. You will see what it can do for your family! Let's meet!

guidance.eng: Replace [SET Time] with your session time before sending the message.

rows.title: After the Session: Thanking Participants and Reminding Them to Practise

title.eng: After the Session: Thanking Participants and Reminding Them to Practise

text.eng: Hello! Thank you for attending our session! Remember, our main activity this week is One-on-One Time with your child. Even just 5 minutes can go a long way! You can do this!

rows.text: Hello! Thank you for attending our session! Remember, our main activity this week is One-on-One Time with your child. Even just 5 minutes can go a long way! You can do this!

rows.title: Day Three: Support Reminder

text.eng: Hi! How is your practice of the homework assignment going? I understand that you may have some challenges with this module. Feel free to text me if you have any questions.Thank you!

the Next Session

text.eng:
Good morning! We've reached the end of the week.
How is One-on-One Time with your children?
Share your successes and challenges! Feel free to be creative in sharing: send stories, voice messages, or pictures. I'd love to hear how your week was at our next session on [INSERT DATE HERE].

rows.title: Message 1: Greetings

text.eng: Greetings  and  Greetings! Welcome  to  Module  2  of  our  MaPaChat!  How  are  you  all?  Are  you  happy? Stressed?  Angry?  Annoyed?  Calm?  Whatever  emotion  you  are  feeling...it's  okay!  Let's  type  what  we're  feeling today

guidance.eng: Give parents a moment to share how they feel. Also, share your own feelings. For example, “I’m happy to be part of our MaPaChat session today

rows.text: Greetings  and  Greetings! Welcome  to  Module  2  of  our  MaPaChat!  How  are  you  all?  Are  you  happy? Stressed?  Angry?  Annoyed?  Calm?  Whatever  emotion  you  are  feeling...it's  okay!  Let's  type  what  we're  feeling today

rows.title: Message 2: Discussion about Home Activity

text.eng: Last week,  we  talked  about  One-on-One  Time. with  the  child.  Today,  we  will  look  at  one  of  the  other  ways  of using  One-on-One  Time—talking  about  feelings with  the  child.  But  first,  let's  chat  about  your  home  activities or  homework.  How  is  your  One-on-One  Time  going?

guidance.eng: Accept the experience that parents will share.

rows.title: Message 5: Discussion about challenge & solution

text.eng: Can  we  work  together  to  come  up  with  a  positive  solution  to  [describe  the  challenge]?  What  might  a  parent  in  that  situation  do?

guidance.eng: Encourage parents to think of positive solutions. You will find some examples of challenges and solutions in the pdf.

rows.title: Message 6

text.eng: Thank  you  so  much  for  your  ideas.  Now  that  you  know  how  to  use  One-on-One  Time  with  your  child,  you  can  also  try  it  with  other  members  of  your  family—like  your  spouse,  parents,  in-laws,  or  even  grandchildren!

rows.text: Thank  you  so  much  for  your  ideas.  Now  that  you  know  how  to  use  One-on-One  Time  with  your  child,  you  can  also  try  it  with  other  members  of  your  family—like  your  spouse,  parents,  in-laws,  or  even  grandchildren!

rows.title: Message 7: Introducing MaPa Skill

text.eng:
Today  we're  going  to  talk  about  MaPa  Skill:  helping  children  manage  their  emotions.  Here  are  five  foundations  for  talking  to  children  about  emotions. 
1.  BREATHE  -  Breathe  before  you  start  to  calm  yourself  down. 
2.  SHARE  -  Share  your  feelings. 
3.  LISTEN  -  Listen  to  your  child  or  teenager. 
4.  PAINFUL  -  Concerned  for  them. 
5.  FIND  -  Find  the  positive

rows.text:
Today  we're  going  to  talk  about  MaPa  Skill:  helping  children  manage  their  emotions.  Here  are  five  foundations  for  talking  to  children  about  emotions. 
1.  BREATHE  -  Breathe  before  you  start  to  calm  yourself  down. 
2.  SHARE  -  Share  your  feelings. 
3.  LISTEN  -  Listen  to  your  child  or  teenager. 
4.  PAINFUL  -  Concerned  for  them. 
5.  FIND  -  Find  the  positive

rows.title: Message 14: Setting a Home Activity

text.eng:
Thank you for sharing your ideas. For this week's homework, practice talking about feelings with your child during your One-on-One time and at other times.
Also try to pay attention to your own feelings as your day goes by.

rows.text:
Thank you for sharing your ideas. For this week's homework, practice talking about feelings with your child during your One-on-One time and at other times.
Also try to pay attention to your own feelings as your day goes by.

rows.title: Message 15: Clarification

text.eng: Do you have any more questions about talking about feelings?

guidance.eng: Allow a few minutes for parents to ask questions. Remember to thank parents for their questions. Before you give your own answer, give the group a chance to think about it and respond by saying "That's a good question! What do others think could be an answer or solution to that?"

rows.text: Do you have any more questions about talking about feelings?

rows.title: Message 18 – Gratitude

text.eng: Thank you. What you did today was difficult but also very important. It will help you manage your stress and give your child the skills to manage their stress. Have a great day!

rows.text: Thank you. What you did today was difficult but also very important. It will help you manage your stress and give your child the skills to manage their stress. Have a great day!

rows.title: Day Three: Reminder to Practise

text.eng:
Hello! Remember that the main activity for this week is to talk about feelings in your One-on-One time and at
other times. Talking about
feelings isn’t easy at first– especially if it’s new to you and your child– so remember to practice.
Good job on your attempt!

rows.text:
Hello! Remember that the main activity for this week is to talk about feelings in your One-on-One time and at
other times. Talking about
feelings isn’t easy at first– especially if it’s new to you and your child– so remember to practice.
Good job on your attempt!

rows.title: Day Five: Feedback

text.eng:
Hi! Could you share something positive that happened when you talked to your child about feelings?
Have you experienced any challenges while trying to do this? Could be creative!
Send stories, voice messages, and pictures. I'd love to hear how your week was when we
meet again on [INSERT DATE HERE].

guidance.eng: Accept submissions by parents for giving thumbs up, emoji, or compliments. Be sure to pick up one or two successes and challenges that can be discussed at the beginning of the next module.

rows.title: Greetings

text.eng:
Greetings! Welcome to Module  2 of our ParentChat!  How are you all?  

😀 Happy? 
😠 Stressed? Angry? Annoyed?  
😌 Calm?  

🌱 Whatever emotion you are feeling...it's  okay!

guidance.eng:
Allow time for parents to share how they are feeling. You should
also share how you are feeling. For example, “I am happy to be part of the chat today.”

rows.title: Discussion about Home Activity

text.eng:
Last week we looked at spending One-on-One time with your child ❤️. Today we look at one of the ways we can use One-on-One time to talk about emotions with our children 💬.

But first, let’s chat about how home practice went. How did One-on-One Time go for you? 😊

guidance.eng: Acknowledge the experiences participants share.

rows.text:
Last week we looked at spending One-on-One time with your child ❤️. Today we look at one of the ways we can use One-on-One time to talk about emotions with our children 💬.

But first, let’s chat about how home practice went. How did One-on-One Time go for you? 😊
rows.guidance: Acknowledge the experiences participants share.

guidance.eng: Share one success that you selected from the feedback parents provided.

rows.title: Introducing the Parenting Tip: Talking about Emotions

title.eng: Introducing the Parenting Tip: Talking about Emotions

text.eng:
Thanks for all of your great ideas 👏. Now let’s move on to today’s parent tip: Helping your children to manage their feelings 💛. Here are 5 tips about how to talk about emotions with your children:
1️⃣ BREATHE to calm yourself before you start.
2️⃣ SHARE how you feel.
3️⃣ LISTEN to your child or teen.
4️⃣ SHOW them you care.
5️⃣ SEEK the positive.

rows.text:
Thanks for all of your great ideas 👏. Now let’s move on to today’s parent tip: Helping your children to manage their feelings 💛. Here are 5 tips about how to talk about emotions with your children:
1️⃣ BREATHE to calm yourself before you start.
2️⃣ SHARE how you feel.
3️⃣ LISTEN to your child or teen.
4️⃣ SHOW them you care.
5️⃣ SEEK the positive.

rows.title: Assignment of Home Activity

text.eng: Thanks for all your great ideas 👏. This week, practice talking to your children about their emotions during One-on-One Time ❤️ and at other times during the week. Try to become more aware of your own emotions as you go about your day, too! 💭

rows.text: Thanks for all your great ideas 👏. This week, practice talking to your children about their emotions during One-on-One Time ❤️ and at other times during the week. Try to become more aware of your own emotions as you go about your day, too! 💭

rows.title: Offer for Questions

text.eng: Any other questions about talking about emotions?

guidance.eng: Allow about a minute for parents to raise any questions. Remember to thank parents for their questions. Before giving your own answer, give the group a chance to come up with ideas by asking, “That’s a great question, what does everyone think?”

rows.title: Audio: Take a Pause

text.eng: Before we end today’s chat session, let’s Take a Pause together ⏸️. Remember, this is something you can do whenever you’re feeling stressed, or your children are getting on your nerves 😌.

rows.text: Before we end today’s chat session, let’s Take a Pause together ⏸️. Remember, this is something you can do whenever you’re feeling stressed, or your children are getting on your nerves 😌.

rows.title: Thank you & Closing

text.eng: Thank you 💛. The work you have done today is hard work – but it’s also very valuable work 🌟. It will help you manage your own stress and give your children the tools they need to manage theirs 💬. Have a peaceful and happy day! 🌼

rows.text: Thank you 💛. The work you have done today is hard work – but it’s also very valuable work 🌟. It will help you manage your own stress and give your children the tools they need to manage theirs 💬. Have a peaceful and happy day! 🌼
